intro: Satureja sylvatica, commonly known as mountain savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and produces small, pink or purple flowers in the summer. Its leaves are fragrant and contain essential oils that contribute to its medicinal and culinary uses. Satureja sylvatica thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for rocky or alpine environments.
